Package org.blab.river

Interface RiverConsumer

All Known Implementing Classes:

public interface RiverConsumer
Interface for consuming messages from River.

  • Method Details

    • poll

      List<Event> poll(long timeout) throws InterruptedException
      Fetch data for the lades specified using subscribe(Set) or subscribe(String) methods.

      This method returns immediately if there are records available. Otherwise, it will await the passed timeout. If the timeout expires, an empty record set will be returned.

      Parameters:
      timeout - maximum time in milliseconds to block. Negative timeout treated as infinity.
      Returns:
      List of events since last fetch.
      Throws:
      RiverException - if there are unrecoverable errors (e.g. configuration or connection exceptions) occurs.
      IllegalStateException - if the consumer was closed before calling this method or if the consumer is not subscribed to any lade.
      InterruptedException - if the thread interrupted during timeout.

    • subscribe

      void subscribe(Set<String> lades)
      Subscribe to all lades from the presented set.

      Skips lades that are already being monitored.

      Throws an exception if invalid lades or pattern provided.

      Parameters:
      lades - lades to subscribe
      Throws:
      RiverException - if there are unrecoverable errors (e.g. configuration or connection exceptions).
      IllegalStateException - if the consumer was closed before calling this method.
      IllegalArgumentException - if invalid lades provided.

    • subscribe

      void subscribe(String pattern)
      Subscribe to all lades matching the specified pattern.

      Skips lades that are already being monitored.

      Throws an exception if invalid pattern provided.

      Parameters:
      pattern - pattern to subscribe
      Throws:
      RiverException - if there are unrecoverable errors (e.g. configuration or connection exceptions).
      IllegalStateException - if the consumer was closed before calling this method.
      IllegalArgumentException - if invalid pattern provided.

    • unsubscribe

      void unsubscribe()
      Unsubscribe from all lades.
      Throws:
      RiverException - if there are unrecoverable errors (e.g. configuration or connection exceptions).
      IllegalStateException - if the consumer was closed before calling this method.

    • close

      void close()
      Close all connections with River.
      Throws:
      RiverException - if there are unrecoverable errors (e.g. configuration or connection * exceptions).
